subject: Cybersecurity
title: Phishing: The Bait in Your Inbox
description: One-minute skill: Phishing: The Bait in Your Inbox.

hook.text: You get an email from your bank asking you to verify your account. The link looks right. It's not.

buildup.text: Phishing emails mimic trusted organizations. They use logos, formatting, and domains that look almost identical.

discovery.text: 3.4 billion phishing emails are sent daily. It's the most common cyber attack in the world.

twist.text: Modern phishing is so sophisticated that even security experts have been fooled by well-crafted messages.

climax.text: One click on a phishing link can give attackers full access to your accounts and network.

punchline.text: 3.4 billion traps land in inboxes every single day.

quiz.question: How many phishing emails are sent daily?
